intro: Tragia bailloniana, commonly known as the Baillon's spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure typical of the genus. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Tragia bailloniana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
